rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Shear Stresses in Diagonally Cracked Reinforced Concrete Beams
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Results are presented on the shear strength of four simple beams, without web reinforcement. All beams had the same over all dimensions. The only difference was that two beams were common monolithic beams while the other two had cast in an artificial diagonal crack at each end. The artificial cracks were located in different positions and with different inclinations. The beams were tested with concentrated loads at third-points.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Civil Engineering

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Some Properties of Compositions and their Applications
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Given an integer n, we define an r-composition of n as follows: An r-composition of n, (t1, ..., tr), is a set of ti where ti>1 is an integer for i = 1, ... , r such that t1 + ... + tr = n. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Mathematics

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: the Surgical Treatment of Experimental Ascites
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The magnitude of the problem of ascites is not readily apparent to the clinician. A classification of conditions in which ascites occurs and a consideration of therapy occupy his thinking when confronted by a patient with the sign. Those actively engaged in investigative work on ascites have attempted to proceed further than their clinical colleagues. The vast void that exists in our knowledge becomes apparent with review of the literature. Only relative success of surgery in ameliorating chronic ascites has prompted the efforts presented within this report.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Experimental Surgery

rdf:Description.dc:contributor: Department of Political Science and Economics
rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Staff Relations in the Canadian Federal Civil Service
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: My interest in the problems of unionism in the public service was aroused in 1953 when, together with R.C. Pratt, I undertook a study of staff relations in Canadian municipalities. This research was subsequently published under our joint authorship as Municipal Labour Relations in Canada. The subject proved to be particularly interesting to me because it raised important questions about public administration and constitutional policy which do not come up in ordinary private labour relations. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Political Science and Economics

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Studies on the Mechanism of Gingival Hyperplasia Induced by Diphenylhldantoin
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Since the discovery of the anti-epileptic action of diphenylhydantoin, it has been repeatedly observed that some patients undergoing treatment develop gingival changes. These changes appear superficially like a low grade inflammatory reaction, showing irregularity of the gingival surface, but progressing slowly to a firm, painless overgrowth of the gums. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Pharmacology

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Pelagic Copepoda Collected off the West Coast of Barbados
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: This paper is a report of the planktonic Copepod material collected from Barbados, British West Indies, during 1956-1958. Only free-living and semi-parasitic copepods have been included. Wickstead (1956) has made a collection of copepods from the Barbados area consisting of 196 hauls over a period of two months, March and April. No previous study has attempted a collection of at least one year, or a plot of the population increase and decrease during the year, although considerable importance is attached to the decrease accompanying the hurricane season, which begins in July and continues until October.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Zoology

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Peridotites of Northern Quebec and Ungava
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The material presented in the body of this thesis is the result of petrographic and mineralographic studies carried out on specimens of peridotite and their associated rock types from various localities in Northern Quebec and Ungava. The major portion of the examination was of a petrographic nature, although a limited amount of polished section work was done on sulphide bearing specimens of ultrabasic rock from some of these same areas.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Geological Science

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: a Theorem of Looman-Menchoff
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: As early as 1825, A. Cauchy was able to establish a theorem which, in the course of time, proved to be the foundation of a large number of researches and advances in the theory of complex variables. This theorem, which for some time has borne Cauchy's name, may be stated in its original form as: [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Mathematics

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Isolation of Carbohydrates from Periodic Acid-Schiff Reactive Sites
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The science of histochemistry is of primary importance in understanding natural phenomena, for it is a science which permits the visualization of the chemistry of a cell component in relation to the cell itself, to the organ of which the cell is a part, and often to the body as a whole. The histochemist is therefore often able to understand the intimate relationships of biological systems better than the chemist or biochemist who is involved with the study of isolated systems.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Anatomy

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Latency and Amplitude of Response and the GSR
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: In 1943, Hull (8) proposed a theoretical model of learning phenomena, which he labeled "the primary laws of molar behavior." The four dependent variables in his model were latency and amplitude of response, probability of reaction evocation, and number of unreinforced responses to extinction; these are related to a number of "major symbolic constructs" or intervening variables (e.g. habit strength, reaction potential), and to various antecedent events and manipulable conditions (e.g., reinforcement, deprivation). [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Psychology

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Chateaubriand et le Merveilleux Chretien dans les Martyrs
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Le présent mémoire se propose d'étudier la tentative de Chateaubriand pour "fonder en raison' le merveilleux chrétien et donner une démonstration qu'i espérait éclatante - de ses possibilités littéraires.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: French

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Chaucer's Use of Dress
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: We may, of course, understand a great deal of Chaucer at first sight; but we shall never comprehend the full Chaucer but by studying those minutiae which are matters of history to us, but which were present everyday commonplaces to the people for whom he wrote. Few minutiae become "matters of history" more quickly than fashions and caprices in dress. We laugh at the styles of twenty-five years ago, consider our grandmother's clothing quaint and the garments of two generations ago romantically beautiful. Fashions which have special significance in their day are quickly changed and forgotten. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: English

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Studies in Pulmonary Diffusion
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: In the past decade pulmonary function tests have assumed an increasingly important and useful role in the field of diagnostic medicine. Many such tests have been devised, but if we consider the lung as ultimately concerned with the exchange of gas between atmosphere and blood, the measurement which perhaps best estimates this process is the pulmonary diffusing capacity. Although the test was conceived early in the century, in the past few years there has been a sudden spurt in its development. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Experimental Medicine

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Studies of a New Thermionic Cathode
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: A new thermionic cathode has been made which has many of the characteristics of the E-cathode made by Dr. Ekkers of the Brown-Boveri Co. In contrast to the oxide-cathode, the new cathode has a firmly bound supply of emitting material near the metal surface; it has a relatively high emission and stands exposure to air. The cathode is made by passing an arc in an atmosphere of argon to a preheated oxide-cathode. The discharge destroys the oxide coating and leaves a thin gold-yellowish layer full of very small craters.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Physics

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: a Spectrometer for the Analysis of Radioactive Ores
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: A circuit which consists essentially of three single channel pulse height analyzing units has been constructed and used in conjunction with a scintillation counting apparatus to assay radioactive ore samples for Uranium and Thorium content. It has proved possible with this instrument to assay ores containing as little as 0.05 % U3O8 or ThO2 with good accuracy.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Physics

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: the Purification and Antiviral Activities of Noxiversin
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: In 1947 a mould was found growing as a contaminant on a Lowenstein's slope which had been inoculated with sputum for the isolation of Mycobacterium tuberculosis. Investigation of the mould showed that it produced, in addition to an antibiotic probably identical with penicillin, a substance capable of neutralizing various bacterial exotoxins (Diena, 1954, 1956; Murray, Denton, Stevenson,and Diena, 1958). The toxin neutralizing substance, now known as noxiversin, was shown to possess, in addition to its antitoxic properties, some activity against influenza virus (Diena, 1956).
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Bacteriology and Immunology

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: a Guide to Ezra Pound: 1885-1920 with Special Emphasis on his Poetic Theory and Practice
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: This paper is offered as a guide to Ezra Pound the poet, critic, translator and writer of letters in the years before he began his major work, The Cantos. Few writers in modern times have published as extensively as he. His writings have appeared in innumerable periodicals and journals, and he has published many books. Most of the books published during the era covered by the present paper are long out of print, and the periodical literature can be found only in library collections. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: English

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: a Study of Conditioned Arousal
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: This historical introduction would have to be greatly extended if it were to deal with the details of the anatomical and physiological developments that led to our present knowledge of the reticular activating or arousal system. Recognition of its significance dates from the publication of a paper by Moruzzi and Magoun (1949) on electrical stimulation of the brainstem reticular formation, and from the appearance of Lindsley's "activation theory" of emotion in the psychological literature. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Psychology

rdf:Description.dc:contributor: Department of Economics and Political Science
rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Tanganyika: Influence of International Trusteeship on Constitutional and Political Development
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: From 1919 until the present day there have always been extreme and contradictory views on the utility and influence of international trusteeship over underdeveloped areas. There are those people who have regarded the system as one of nuisance-value only, and those who have regarded it as a blessing, and yet others who have regarded its principles and objectives as being synonymous with the best of colonial principles and practices and, for that reason, no innovation.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Economics and Politcal Science

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Investigation of the Response of Electromechanical Servomechanisms in Combined Linear and Nonlinear Operation
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The work described in this thesis comprises the first in a series of projects dealing with servomechanisms at the Department of Electrical Engineering of McGill University. The particular problem investigated was the control of a servomechanism with one nonlinearity, the saturation of the driving element. As a result of the work a twofold purpose was fulfilled. An insight was gained into the problem of utilizing nonlinear control to optimise the transient response, and test equipment and procedures were developed to facilitate complete testing of all aspects of servomechanisms.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Engineering

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Ordovician Ostracoda from the St. Lawrence Lowlands of Quebec
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: This paper is mainly concerned with the description and illustration of ostracod species collected from Ordovician sediments of the St. Lawrence Lowlands, the determination of their stratigraphic ranges, and the methods used in preparing the specimens for examination, identification and photography. A brief outline of the stratigraphy, structure and economics of these Ordovician sediments is included to provide a background for the palaeontological portion of the paper. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Geological Science

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Studies of Radioactive Krypton of Low Mass
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: This thesis deals with (1) technical developments whereby excellent spot and line sources of radioactive krypton were produced for spectrometers and (2) the discovery of an isomeric state in Kr76 m. This isomer decays with a half-life of 15.5 hours predominantly by electron capture to Br76 and is followed by a strong Ml gamma ray of 45.6 kev in energy. Indeed the conversion lines for six gamma rays were observed to decay with the 15.5 hour half-life. An isomeric transition in Kr76 was not definitely recognized among the many weak conversion lines. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Physics

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Corticosteroidogenesis
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The biochemistry of the steroid hormones continues to engage the efforts of a large number or research workers. Excellent reviews of steroid biochemistry which have appeared in the past few years include those of Lieberman and Teich (1), Roberts and Szego (2) and Samuels (3). The genesis of the adrenocortical secretions has been exhaustively and capably reviewed by Hechter and Pincus (4) and Pincus (5).
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Biochemistry

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The Stratigraphy and Palaeontology of the Beekmantown Group in the St. Lawrence Lowlands, Quebec
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: In southern Quebec the Lower Ordovician or Beekmantown series consists of a thick sequence of dolomite beds with minor amounts of sandstone, limestone and shale. By comparison with Lower Ordovician strata elsewhere, the Beekmantown in southern Quebec is relatively unfossiliferous. As a result, interest in the group has been slight. This study is a dissertation on the stratigraphy and palaeontology of the Beekmantown group as exposed in the Quebec portion of the St. Lawrence Lowlands.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Geological Science

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: the Role of Eye Movements in Perception
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: A series of experiments initiated by Mishkin and Forgays (7) has established that a response may be more easily elicited by stimulating one area of the retina rather than another. These investigators exposed English words tachistoscopically in either the left or the right visual field. Although the words appeared in areas of comparable visual acuity, they were more easily recognized when they were in the right field.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Psychology
